I do not have access to real-time information on specific restaurants that are doing a great job with their allergen protocols.

however, there are several resources available that can help you find restaurants with good allergen protocols, such as:

1. allergyeats: this website and app allow users to search for restaurants in their area that offer allergen-friendly options. users can also read reviews and ratings from other diners with allergies.

2. opentable: this website and app allow users to search for restaurants with specific dietary restrictions, including gluten-free, dairy-free, and vegetarian options. while this may not specifically target allergens, it can still be a useful tool for identifying restaurants with a variety of options.

3. faan: the food allergy and anaphylaxis network has a comprehensive guide for dining out with food allergies, including a list of restaurants with good allergen protocols.

4. yelp: users can search for restaurants in their area and filter by keywords such as "allergen-friendly," "gluten-free," or "nut-free." this can provide some insight into what other diners have experienced.

remember, it's important to always communicate your allergies or dietary restrictions to the restaurant and ask for specific instructions and safety measures.
